programme.title: Rubber Jellyfish
programme.desc: Balloons' harmful effects, to us and to our environment, have been greenwashed and kept a secret for decades.

programme.title: Ice Dogs: The Only Companions Worth Having
programme.desc: As the light returns to Greenland, we arrive in Scoresbysund with a troop of the only companions worth having.

programme.title: Africa's Wild Roommates
programme.desc: From small insects to large mammals, these different species live together, benefitting from sharing a roof.

programme.title: Banquet of the Beasts
programme.desc: Science is on the trail of a macabre challenge: to dissect in detail what happens to dead animals in the wild.

programme.title: Changing Seas
programme.desc: When the Hawaii-to-Alaska humpback whale population suddenly dropped, scientists wanted to know what happened.

programme.title: Whale Adventures with Nigel Marven
programme.desc: Newborn gray whale calves spend their first months of life in the safety of Baja’s San Ignacio Lagoon.

programme.title: Whale Adventures with Nigel Marven
programme.desc: Nigel takes a boat into the Santa Barbara channel to catch up with the gray whales as they swim past.

programme.title: Whale Adventures with Nigel Marven
programme.desc: Nigel enjoys the celebration of the Quileute people's annual ‘Welcome the Whales’ ceremony.

programme.title: Whale Adventures with Nigel Marven
programme.desc: The whales are now on the home stretch. Nigel goes to the far west of Alaska to try to see them as they pass.

programme.title: Plastic: The Real Sea Monster
programme.desc: Plastic enters the ocean annually, and it doesn't break down. How does this affect our oceans, and humanity?

programme.title: Africa's Primeval Oceans
programme.desc: The Cape of Storms marks where Atlantic and Indian oceans meet off Africa, shaping land, life, and climate.

programme.title: The Last Mermaids: Huntresses of the Sea
programme.desc: For over 2,000 years, the women of South Korea's Jeju Island have become Haenyos: female sea divers.

programme.title: Sharks: The Big Five
programme.desc: Dive into African waters for an insightful look at sharks. You'll learn how they play a vital role in nature.

programme.title: Turtles: Prehistoric Beasts
programme.desc: Contrary to our perceptions of turtles as slow animals, they are impressively dangerous predators.

programme.title: Penguins: The African Chaplin
programme.desc: The African penguin is Africa's only penguin species, but their numbers are falling. What could the reason be?

programme.title: Herders: The Ancient Tradition Lives On
programme.desc: Every year, a master shepherd takes 200 black-headed sheep through the middle of the German capital of Berlin.

programme.title: Herders: The Ancient Tradition Lives On
programme.desc: In Kyrgyzstan, herders drive their herds into the mountains to pastures at nearly 2,500 meters (8,000 feet).

programme.title: Herders: The Ancient Tradition Lives On
programme.desc: In northeastern Uganda, a herder finds that a disease affecting cattle threatens his livelihood.

programme.title: Herders: The Ancient Tradition Lives On
programme.desc: A Raika camel herd has scattered throughout the dry forest of the Rajasthan land in northwest India.

programme.title: Herders: The Ancient Tradition Lives On
programme.sub-title: Living with Alpacas in the Peruvian Andes
programme.desc: The rapidly changing climate threatens the way of life for an alpaca herder in the high Andes of Peru.

programme.title: If There Was No Land On Earth
programme.desc: Embark on a breathtaking underwater voyage to explore the awe-inspiring beauty and big secrets of coral reefs.

programme.title: If There Was No Land On Earth
programme.desc: Along the gorgeous coast of an area in New Guinea, explore the mesmerizing coral gardens of the Raja Ampat.

programme.title: If There Was No Land On Earth
programme.desc: Explore the fairytale paradise of Raja Ampat. Experience the great riches found in and around its waters.

programme.title: If There Was No Land On Earth
programme.desc: Discover the elusive side of the Raja Ampat archipelago. Rarely seen, it harbors many rare plants and animals.

programme.title: If There Was No Land On Earth
programme.sub-title: In The Shadow of The Night
programme.desc: Head out on the trail of underwater mountain peaks, and learn of the inhabitants who come alive at sunset.
